column5: Does 2020 Sport Fishing variation order for Fisheries Management Zone 5, Schedule B – Exceptions to the Zone-wide close times, quotas and size limits for Fisheries Management Zone 5, Conservation fishing licence quota and size limits, Winnipeg River System, apply to Non-Canadians? (Versus previous quota of one.) That is: 2, Walleye must be between 35* 45 cm and only one 1 Sauger greater than 45 cm.Reference: https://www.ontario.ca/page/sport-fi...ne-5#section-4Thanks, Terry
I'm not a brain surgeon I can't figure that post out, that's rocket science

You need to hire an environmental lawyer to interpret those regs. I read it a few times, and I still can’t make heads or tails of it. It seems that only Section D specifically addresses non-Canadians, but doesn’t mention the Winnipeg River System, so I have to assume all other regs apply to both residents and non-residents. I guess...
Lol right? Glad I’m not the only one who was going cross-eyed from reading those regs. Clear as mud.

This is how I interpret that: You can possess 1 Walleye between 35 and 45cm in length OR it can be over 70cm OR 1 Sauger of any size. In the stated water region.So 1 fish. They often combine similar species into the same limit. Sent from my SM-A530W using Tapatalk
Good job adempsey on that one,if I wouldn't have dropped out of school after the 7th grade maybe I could have helped that guy out
